data.title: Experienced Attorneys in Albany NY
data.meta_description: The legal team at Maynard, O’Connor, Smith & Catalinotto, LLP includes the most highly respected attorneys, trial lawyers and litigators in Albany NY.
data.text:
Mike Catalinotto, our senior partner, has been an integral member of the firm for over 50 years. He is an intelligent, intense litigator, earning the highest possible Martindale-Hubbell ranking of AV from his fellow practitioners, a testament to the fact that his peers rank him at the highest level of professional excellence.

Jim has spent his entire professional career at Maynard, O’Connor, Smith & Catalinotto, where he is managing partner. He leads the firm’s real property practice handling matters relating to acquisition and sale, residential and commercial lending, land use planning, real estate litigation, and title insurance claims. He also manages the firm’s commercial, business, and trusts and estates areas of practice, overseeing a team of qualified attorneys and paralegals who provide our clients with a full range of legal services.

Michael E. Catalinotto, Jr. is a trial lawyer who concentrates his practice in defending physicians and hospitals in complex medical malpractice cases throughout New York State. In over 30 years of practice, Michael has successfully obtained numerous verdicts and favorable settlements in a variety of complex and high exposure cases including birth, trauma and wrongful death claims.

Rob joined Maynard, O’Connor, Smith, & Catalinotto in 1997 and was named a partner in 2004. Prior to joining the firm, he served as Law Clerk to Hon. Irad S. Ingraham, New York State Supreme Court Justice for Chenango and Otsego Counties. Through that experience, he gained extensive exposure to trial practice and the intricacies of New York State civil practice rules and regulations.

Since joining Maynard O’Connor in 2010, Justin has concentrated his practice in the areas of real property litigation and transactions, title defense litigation, commercial litigation and transactions, general civil litigation, appeals, residential and commercial lending, business law and transactions, health care law and bankruptcy (creditor’s rights). He is admitted to practice in the State of New York; the State of New Jersey; the U.S. District Courts for the Northern, Southern and Western Districts of New York, and New Jersey; and the U.S. Bankruptcy Courts for the Northern and Southern District of New York, and New Jersey.

Karen A. Butler, R.N., BSN, J.D., combines more than twenty years’ experience as a critical care nurse with her skills as a practicing attorney. Her areas of practice include medical malpractice defense, professional misconduct, health law and civil rights litigation. Karen is admitted to practice law in all the courts of the State of New York, in both the Northern and Southern Districts of New York and in the United States Supreme Court.

Kelly has been a trial attorney for over 13 years, defending hospitals and medical professionals against medical negligence claims, as well as defending medical professionals in matters before the New York State Justice Center, New York State Office of Professional Medical Conduct (OPMC) and the New York State Education Department. His practice areas also include general liability defense, personal injury, premises liability, and defending petroleum suppliers in New York State Navigation Law claims.

Bridget joined the firm in 2016. She concentrates her practice in the areas of real estate litigation; commercial litigation; title insurance claims; property disputes; business formation; contract drafting and negotiation, including lease agreements; residential and commercial real estate acquisition and sale; landlord/tenant; general liability; appeals; trusts and estates. She is admitted to practice in the State of New York.

Since joining the firm as an associate attorney in 2019, Kelly has been serving clients with her exceptional legal expertise, dedication, and commitment. She concentrates her practice on the representation of defendants in a wide variety of personal injury litigation matters, including premises liability, motor vehicle accidents, construction site litigation, and medical malpractice. In addition to her defense work, she also represents plaintiffs in similar personal injury litigation matters.

Rosy is a 2016 graduate of New York City College of Technology, where she received her Bachelor of Science in Legal Studies. Rosy then went on to receive her J.D. from Vermont Law & Graduate School in 2022. Rosy focuses her practice in representing defendants in the areas of civil litigation, including medical malpractice, premises liability, motor vehicle negligence, and general liability.

Akim attended the State University of New York at Oswego, where he received his Bachelor of Arts in English and Political Science in 2019. Akim then received his Juris Doctorate’s from Albany Law School, graduating with honors in 2022. Prior to joining the firm, Akim gained extensive experience in workers’ compensation and labor and employment issues. During his time in workers’ compensation, Akim developed skills relating directly to personal injury and general litigation.

A practicing attorney for more than 30 years, Ed successfully litigates multi-million dollar cases for doctors and hospitals, defending claims of medical malpractice. He also represents municipalities and school districts on civil rights and zoning claims and claims of general municipal negligence. Ed was designated a “2021 top rated lawyer” by Martindale Hubbell.

Concetta handles complex personal injury litigation representing individuals and families who have been injured as a result of an accident, including car and construction site accidents; unsafe premises; defective products; dog bites; and wrongful death matters. She has been with the firm since 1986 and became a partner in 1993.

Since joining the firm in 1981 and becoming a partner in 1986, Tom has become one of our top litigators. His experience in defense litigation includes cases involving catastrophic injury, product liability, municipal law, and property damage. Tom also handles estate litigation, professional liability law, and business/commercial litigation.

Bruce has served as a trial attorney with the firm for more than 30 years, successfully defending hospitals and doctors in medical malpractice claims and representing plaintiffs in employment discrimination matters and personal injury cases. His practice areas also include employment and municipal law, products liability, and general litigation, with extensive working knowledge of the various levels of state and federal laws that govern employment claims, particularly those involving discrimination and sexual harassment.
